7.5.17  6:42 pm   You've said the best way to come up with chords is by selecting the chord(s) that best support the melody... But, what about if you're accompanying a soloist who is improvising and you don't know what the melody notes are going to be? How would you come up with interesting chord substitutions/changes to support the melody if you don't know where the melody is going?

7.5.17  6:22 pm   Howdy! You answer a lot of questions on here about melody and harmony... but I noticed you don't get as many questions about rhythm and percussion... I'm wondering if you ever take a rhythmic figure or idea and use that as a skeleton to build the melody/chords around? How often (if ever) do you write songs starting with just the drums/percussion?
